CatDescriptText: Mr. Kenneth Dozier, restaurant worker, 6500 Meadow Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "No, is my answer to both questions, because to do so would be wrong.  Sunday is a religious day and it should be kept that way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kenneth Dozier wearing light colored short sleeved uniform shirt, apron, and light colored cap, standing on Liberty Avenue with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
